Reviews.Title: “Awful Hotel! I would never stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: m s
Reviews.Content: Horrible and bitter experience in Barcelona! Booked me for an extra night and refuse to refund even after confirming that they would do so. The breakfast was like dirt served in a tin can! The room smelled like someone pooped on the walls then sprinkled pubic hairs all over. The AC did not work properly. The heat stayed on all night even after turning off the thermostat. I didn't sleep a wink and even went as far to pull the dad gum thermostat off the wall. The heat still stayed on full blast. The hotel is haunted. I explained the situation to the front desk and they looked at me like I was a complete moron and then proceeded to explain that it was not possible because "none of our rooms have working air conditioning". The fire alarms started going off early in the morning for no reason. I couldn't believe their service at this point. Never ever stay here!

Reviews.Title: “a good hotel for a hospital visit”
Reviews.Author: Lucio F
Reviews.Content: if you want a four star hotel in Barcelona that does not cost the earth, go to the Alimara. it is very far from the city centre but well connected by underground; and it is near (walking distance, 7 minutes) the main University Hospital. So, if you are a doctor of a relative of a patient, it seems perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms and nearby subway”
Reviews.Author: TravlinfoolSeattle
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Alimara Hotel before a cruise and found it to be very comfortable and convenient to the main touristic areas using the nearby subway which is the main line into Barca. The room was quite large and modern. The bathroom was very clean and large as well. I recommend it if you are not spooked by using public transportation. The hotel is a great value and probably less that half of what you'd pay anywhere near the Ramblas or port.

Reviews.Title: “Eager service with a smile”
Reviews.Author: drswaim
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here because we had a rental car during our two-week trip to Spain and didn't want to be in the center of the city. So glad we did! The hotel is around the corner from the Metro and we easily took it into the city. As a bonus, the surrounding area is residential and we were able to park across the street from the hotel for free, saving the 15 euro per night hotel fee. The hotel is staffed by students from the hospitality college next door and they couldn't have been more eager or more helpful. We were in room 825 and had corner windows that could open for fresh air. The bathroom and bedroom were both huge and spotless. The room had a fridge and a very comfortable bed plus lots of outlets for charging up our cameras and phone. It was a very quiet neighborhood yet near a major highway that got us to the airport easily. Our rate included a buffet breakfast that was quite adequate - lots of breads, rolls, cold cuts, cheeses, juices and eggs, pancakes and waffles as well as Tortilla Espanola. Unfortunately, Wifi was only available in the public areas.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: romandavydov
Reviews.Content: If you looking for good price and want to get good quality at the same time - this is the perfect solution. Yes, it's located not in the city center, but next door to the station of metro and only 15 minutes from the city center. Rooms nice and modern, clean and comfortable. Hotel located 35 Eur by taxi from Barcelona International Airport (BCN). Breakfast if perfect with good quality of food and good selection of food.

Reviews.Title: “3 than 4 stars...”
Reviews.Author: v-integrale
Reviews.Content: In all above comments I will add the "insufficient" Internet service that this hotel offer..(slow baud speed and often out of work).. The coffee in breakfast was awful and the hole breakfast table was "poor".. Also the magnetic card for door opening were usually not fuctional and I had to return to reception for change it... The only positive thing was the gently and very helpful persons in reception

Reviews.Title: “Stay if the price is right...”
Reviews.Author: tangek
Reviews.Content: We are a party of 2 adults and a 3 year old child staying for 3 nights, and rented a deluxe room with space for an extra bed. We were assigned room 503, and had an amazingly spacious room with a surprise: a large balcony with an excellent view of the surrounding hills, including Tibidabo. The hotel was new and had a modern design, which we enjoyed, although there were a few kinks which the hotel still needs to work out. The hotel was away from down town Barcelona, but the Metro was clean, quick, and efficient so we did not mind the travel, especially with a 3 day travel card. The hotel was an easy 2 block walk from the closest Metro stop (Mundet). Our room had two twin beds put together for a large bed, with a rollaway bed for our son. We also had a chair and foot stool, desk, flat screen TV, and built in closets / shelving with a redridgerator unit. Our room also had small safe. The hotel had free wireless internet service in the lobby, although it was painfully slow. In the rooms, we had to buy internet service (from the desk, via a pre-paid card system). This fee-based wireless internet was much faster, and reasonably affordable EUR 6.00 per 24 hours. Despite being near a highway, the room was rather quiet and we had a peaceful night’s sleep. We used the air conditioning unit, but if we had chosen to leave the windows open, we would certainly have had traffic noise. The bathroom was spacious and new, with ample toiletries provided (even a bath sponge!). We had a large sink with plenty of countertop space, a walk-in shower with a glass side, and a separate room for the toilet with a bidet. Our only complaint about the bathroom was that the water ran out of the shower and flooded into the toilet area, despite our best efforts to manage the direction and speed of the shower. We ate dinner at the hotel restaurant twice, once after our late arrival, and once again when we realized that a nearby restaurant was closed. The food was good quality, although not as interesting in selection as what we found in the center of Barcelona. Our rate also came with breakfast, which was adequate although uninspired compared to other hotels we have stayed at recently. The buffet-style arrangement included eggs, cereal, yogurt, cheese, ham (which was excellent), bread, and fresh fruit. The coffee machine was self service, and frequently ran out of milk. On the positive side, the breakfast room was not overcrowded and we had no issue finding a table each day. The front desk staff was friendly, although not always knowledgeable. At one point, they sent us to a nearby restaurant for dinner which turned out to be closed. And they told us that it would take no more than 40 minutes to reach the airport by train, although it took us nearly double that on our arrival (and we could not figure out a faster way). Upon checkout, we took a taxi from the hotel to the airport. Despite leaving during the evening rush hour, it took us less than 30 minutes to get to the airport. If we saw an excellent value price for this hotel, we would consider staying again. For an expensive rate, it may be more convenient to stay downtown, especially if you are visiting for just the weekend or looking to go out late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect,clean and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: AngelaDimit
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in this hotel. The hotelroom was very clean, very nice beds and pillows, the curtains were black and did not let any sunshine come through, so you could sleep as long as you want. There was absolutely no noise from neighbours or the street, it was very quiet, very important for a good night rest. The bathroom very big and clean. The location was for us very good, we wouldn't sleep in a hotel near the ramblas because of the noise 24h a day. It was a 2 minute walk to the Metro (Mundet) and ik 10 minutes you reach station Catalunya, begin of the Ramblas. The Neighbourhood was very quiet and safe. We would recommend this hotel for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Afrovibe
Reviews.Content: Comfortable hotel. Unfortuntely I could not turn off the airconditioner in my room which disrupted my sleep patterns. Having said that I enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, accessible”
Reviews.Author: truckieandthewife
Reviews.Content: Great hotel clearly set up for conferences but has many other assets. Rooms were spacious and clean. Breakfast was good with lots of choices from the buffet. The best thing about the hotel is it is literally a one minute walk from the Mundet metro stop. This stop takes only 10 minutes to get into the main city center at Catalunya. It has a lovely garden. It does have a few draw back but these can be easily overcome. There is no pool, the restaurant menu is limited and only available at certain times. The biggest draw back for us was the internet, they advertised free wi-fi which was the selling point but it was only free downstairs . So you must sit in the bar or outside in the garden. However we need to skype and that was difficult due to the noise of a conference and bar. You can however pay to have wi-fi in the room but this is expensive as was the laundering service.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - not the best location for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: StephAussieB
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel for three nights. As someone who is used to staying in hostels/backpackers I was obviously very impressed with the lovely new facilities, the room was great, had a television, safe, mini-bar, table & chair, very nice bathroom with toiletries provided. Although we booked for a double room we got two single beds pushed together - which wasn't always ideal (!) but the beds themselves were comfy to sleep in. We had breakfast included and it did the job, tea/coffee, lots of greasy meat, fruit/yoghurt/pastries/bread etc. If it isn't included with your room I would consider getting something cheaper though, not sure it would be worth the 14 Euro! The staff were nice enough and helpful. Some staff weren't so good with English but to be fair it might have been my Australian accent they struggled with! As for the location, it is basically next door to the Metro stop Mundet on L3, if you are going for a few days I would recommend buying a T10 travel card. It is about 15mins from Mundet to Catalunya (where you can access Las Ramblas), and because the Metro is so easy to navigate we didn't really find it a huge problem to be on the outskirts of town. However if you are the kind of person who likes to be able to nip home during the day for a rest/shower, this hotel may not be for you. Overall a positive experience :)

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Sodman
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed at the Alimara July 6-13 on business and pleasure. The staff was very helpful in giving advise about Barcelona, the subway system, etc. Subway line 3 is only a 2-3 min walk away and provides direct access to many of the main downtown attractions (15-20 min) as well as transfer stations to other subway lines and the train station. Buy the 10 use pass for the best value. When my son's passport was stolen, the hotel staff researched and gave us detailed directions to the US Consulate. We got there early (8:30 am) and were first in line. It only took 35 min to get a new passport - make sure you take a photocopy of your passport with you. The hotel is quite new and the room sufficiently large. However, there are no comfortable chairs. Of course you wouldn't stay in the room watching TV unless it were rainy outside, so it wasn't an issue for us. The prices at the restaurant were quite high, so it is better to take the subway downtown and eat. There are no other restaurants close by but there is a large grocery about a 5 min walk away. You can get free WiFi in the lobby area.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Zaganov
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here for two nigths. Alimara Hotel is out of the city center. But very close to the Metro Station - green line L3 -MUNDET. It means you're 15 minutes from the city center. I got an internet promotion and payed 76 Eur/night with breakfast included. In city center i've seen 2 star Hotels asking for more than 100 eur. The Hotel is situated in a calm area and the room was a very nice and positive surprise. The only thing I didn't liked it were the other facilities or the lack of them. Room service is... Telepizza. Its true they put a brochure advertising their services and goods price. I've never seen nothing like this and i'm not saying is a bad thing. Just unusual. The kitchen closes at 11pm when most of spanish people is starting to dinner, an restaurant/bar closes at 11h30pm on saturdays. The breakfast on weekends starts at 08h00 am and it's opened till 11h30 am. This schedule seems to be good, however if case you need to leave earlier there's no solution. You go with an empty stomach unless you ask in advance (previous day before 11 Pm). I was not lucky, arrived at 11h10 and there were no cookers anymore. Had breakfast in the airport. In overall this is a good hotel, with a good value for the money, with a good bedroom. The other services are not so good, but if uou prepare yourself everything will be fine

Reviews.Title: “I would stay again in a second”
Reviews.Author: Albuquerque_NMGeezer
Reviews.Content: It is about 10-15-minutes by metro from anywhere you want to visit but for this you get a large modern room at a reasonable price. We observed that any extras such a laundry or breakfast were incredibly overpriced but available elsewhere. Nothing in a largely residential neighborhood thankfully including pickpockets but you will have to run the gauntlet every time you go through one of the tourist area stations.We had three failed attempts but thankfully all used the same easy to spot method. A blocker to obstruct you getting into the train and a second person coming up behind to push and clean you out. It anybody obstructs your entrance (including 85-year old ladies with crutches) either step aside and stair at them-thy will leave or just push by hard and fast. The staff is helpful and the rooms are kept shiny clean.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay in a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveller190784
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Barcelona and we were at first concerned to see that the hotel appeared to be quite a way from the city centre. However, the hotel made up for this. We arrived at 10.15pm and although the restuarant closed at 10.30pm, they were kind enough to prepare a snack for us and a much needed hot drink. The room was very clean, with a good sized bathroom. The buffet breakfast was excellent with a great choice of foods.The room safe was a bonus. We found the staff friendly and helpful and happy to answer any of our questions. Having the metro station near the hotel was a postive and we found that from L3, it was easy to get to all the places we planned to visit. A two day travel card costs 11.50 euros. The hotel were happy to look after our luggage on our last day as we were picking up our transfer transport from there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, far from city center but has a metro anyway”
Reviews.Author: daphiness
Reviews.Content: If you look at its location on a map of Barcelona, it's right at the very edge. We were worried at first but after our first day, we knew we got ourselves a fantastic deal. The price was great especially when compared with hotels located at the heart of Barcelona but rated with lower stars. And although far from many things, having a metro station literally right behind the hotel makes it convenient. The room was spacious although the bed was really two beds put together. The bathroom was also large. Decor was very clean and simple. There's free wi-fi at the lobby but you need to get the password from the front desk every 24 hours - and it was sometimes difficult to connect. Would be great if the wi-fi reached the rooms!

Reviews.Title: “A complete makeover”
Reviews.Author: alexhampshire30350
Reviews.Content: We visit our kids in Barca from time to time and always check to see if we can get a good room rate. This weekend it was good at about 70€ for the room. At first glance the hotel is right out of town next to the Ronda de Dalt but because it has secure parking and sits right next to the tube line into the middle of town it suits us fine. The hotel has recently been completely refurbished and looks good.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: yaallla
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel for 4 days and it was great. good location right next to the metro station but in a quiet neighbourhood. good stores near by and the place was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice”
Reviews.Author: SpelaS
Reviews.Content: I've been to Barcelona quite a few times so I almost know it by heart or at least my heart wishes so. :) This time we stayed in Alimara hotel in northern part of Barcelona, the newer part of Vall d'Hebron. It turned out to be a very good choice. Besides all the obvious things: new design, nice and helpful staff, safe neighborhood, easy to find,..., the metro station is literally around the corner. We needed exactly 7 minutes to leave our room, get to the reception, check out, go to the metro and step on the train. The line L3 is basically the main metro line of the city, so it took us only 12 minutes to get to the city center and less than 30 to get to the Saints estacio. The grocery shop is in the building beside, so is a cafe. The room was nice and clean, air conditioned, had a minibar, LCD TV and a big beautiful bathroom. The pillow was so comfortable I had a hard time not taking it home. And I usually have problems with hotel pillows... The only bad thing is the road near by, but if you keep the window closed, you can't hear the traffic. This hotel is a very good priced hotel and I'd really recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice cheap hotel very close to Metro station. Good place for a weekend stay!”
Reviews.Author: wickerman767
Reviews.Content: I've stayed there for 3 nights on my short sightseeing trip to Barcelona. It's a nice cheap hotel located literally next door to Mundet metro station. I didn't stay much at the hotel as we were mostly sightseeing but the room was nice and quite clean. Maybe not 4 star, but 3 star standard. Hotel staff was ok but not very helpful and didn't speak fluent English. I would stay there again for the same price but definitely would come back to Barcelona in the Summer as February was a bit cold, as it was expected.

Reviews.Title: “Immaculate, modern and quiet.”
Reviews.Author: gus24o8
Reviews.Content: As a plus: If you drive from abroad this is the ideal place for you. Everybody knows what can happen if you leave a foreign number plate car in the street. This hotel has an inside parking with large access (very hard to find in Barcelona), so you can sleep worry free. We had a triple room which was large, modern and very clean. The flat screen tv offered lots of channels with few in English. The air conditioning worked well and made the difference. The bathroom was spacious and shiny but it had only a shower(no bathtub!), a bit unusual for a four star hotel. As a minus: At the reception was different. Nice staff, decent English but only one person at he desk sometimes. I had to wait 15 minutes for a question. The wi-fi is outrageously expensive! Thin walls, so late noisy guests can wake you up in the middle of the night. Overall: Location is great. Tube at the end of the street, supermarket across the road, quiet and pleasant area. Overall a nice place especially if you have a car to take care of.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel in a Noisy area”
Reviews.Author: oscar28
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 days at this hotel during our first visit to Barcelona. It is quite a modern hotel with usual facilities in the room including the essential safe for keeping your valuables. Breakfast has quite good variety and the food was really quite good. The wireless internet is quite expensive but guests are allowed a free 15mins on their own wired PC so it is OK if you just want to keep in touch and tell friends you have arrived safely. There are also quite a bit of facilities nearby including a supermarket which sells 5 litres of distilled water for about $1, essential in the summer heat. The hotel is very near a subway station which is one of the best features of this otherwise average hotel. The downside of this hotel is that it is on the city ring road so you can hear the road noise from any room except the ground or lower floors. I requested to change room due to noise but they simply changed me to another room facing the other side of the traffic. The service staff was not very helpful with car parking and advised us that we have to pay for hotel car park despite the fact that it is free parking opposite the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Renovated”
Reviews.Author: mjib
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews here before departing, our expectations weren't high. The rooms are now newly renovated in a modern black and white style which exceeded our expectations. The hotel is situated in a quiet residential area which is around 20 minutes from central barcelona which is just right for us because we like quiet and spacious areas. The hotel is clean and breakfast was standard hotel choices. Service could have been better as we had to ask for things like breakfast location and time.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star but reasonable value”
Reviews.Author: CSJAberdeen
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel at 1am around the start if April and stayed for five nighrs. Check in was easy and straight forward with no problems. Our room was a decent size but very hot on arrival so switched on the air con, which only blew out even hotter air. On querying this I was told the whole hotels air con didn't work. Not a huge problem in April when it was relatively cool but would hate to stay here in the summer!! The guy on the desk did not speak great English (none of them appeared to) and was not much help. The room was slightly grubby with plaster peeling in the ceiling but for the price we paid was ok but I felt this was a long way off from a 4 star!! I think the reason this hotel is reasonably priced is because of its location. It is a good but out from the city centre. This was not a problem for us as it was just 500 yards from a Metro station. I have copied the following bit from someone elses review as the description is spot on - 'Travel to and from the airport is easy and cheap if you take the train, takes around 40 minutes. Take the train to Placias de Gracia and then change over to the L3 line to Mundet. The same metro ticket is valid for the whole travel. Take care that you dont exit the metro station while trying to locate the metro lines during the change. Exit the Mundet metro station on the left hand side (when the platform is behind you) and then turn right after the ramp. The hotel is at the end of the road on the right hand side.' I would say it take about an hour though, not 40 minutes. The food at the hotel is pretty good too which we weren't expecting and a fair price. Turn left at the hotels door as you exit and you will see a large white appartment block. Within the centre of this you will find a large supermarket which stocks everything you need and is pretty cheap. Also, there is a Cafe a bit up from the supermarket in the same square which sells cheap things for breakfast and the people there are very friendly. The hotel seems to be in a nice enough location and '3 stars' seems to be a much fairer rating than the four they claim to have.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, could be closer though.”
Reviews.Author: jendunphy
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel with lovely staff and lovely large rooms. It was only 2 min walk from metro station with 20 mins to city centre and two min walk to a supermarket. The only thing we didn't like was the breakfast and most days we ate out. But overall great hotel

Reviews.Title: “A good option for a car holidays”
Reviews.Author: enona
Reviews.Content: This was part of a car travelling holidays to Barcelona. The hotel is far from Barcelona city centre but it's served by a metro station very close to the hotel and you can reach the city centre on 10/15 minutes. This was a modern hotel, with a very good room, clean and spacious. The hotel streets have also some free parking space on the street that was very helpful for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, geat value, not so great service”
Reviews.Author: sxxd
Reviews.Content: I and my husband stayed at the Alimara for 5 nights during Christmas last week. Dont expect a 4star hotel service, but the rooms are great value if you want to spend only the nights in the hotel and the days travelling the wonderful city! POSITIVES- Travel to and from the airport is easy and cheap if you take the train, takes around 40 minutes. Take the train to Placias de Gracia and then change over to the L3 line to Mundet. The same metro ticket is valid for the whole travel. Take care that you dont exit the metro station while trying to locate the metro lines during the change. The hotel was in a great location, just 15 mins to City centre (Catalunya) by the metro and the metro station (Mundet, L3 line) was less than 500m away from the hotel! Exit the Mundet metro station on the left hand side (when the platform is behind you) and then turn right after the ramp. The hotel is at the end of the road on the right hand side. Nice locality and there's a very handy supermarket in the basement of the white colored flats opposite the hotel building. The room was very clean, very good size and the bathroom was wonderful! House keeping was also quite satisfactory. NEGATIVES: The desk staff were not very polite or welcoming. We were handed the room keys on check-in and the lady at the desk did not even bother to suggest the floor number for the rooms or the where the lift was. We had requested a double bed in our booking but when we arrived what we got was 2 single beds put side by side. We requested for a double bed again at the reception but again the lady flatly (almost rude) told us that there was nothing else available and she could not do anything about it because it was just a "request" we had put and so it was not guaranteed. BIGGEST NEGATIVE - We were carrying travellers cheques and requested those to be encashed at the reception. Everytime (4-5 times for 2 days) the lady available at the reception said that she would not be able to help us and we had to ask at the reception between 11am-2pm in the afternoon! (That meant we had to stay back at the hotel for any proper answer about the cheques and not go out!!!) At another time, another lady told us that they did it only if we had loyalty card or something like that with the hotel!!! How do they expect tourists to have a card with the hotel is beyond my imagination....In the end, we had the travleers cheques encashed at a currency exchange shop. SUMMARY - very good value for money if you want a clean, decent sized place to sleep in a good locality with good connectivity to city and airport. You may be disappointed if you are looking for good customer service. We wanted just the former and are satisfied with what we got.

Reviews.Title: “surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Initiative
Reviews.Content: POSITIVES ok this was one of my favourite trips in Europe...what a wonderful city!i had no idea about the hotel because it was a surprise trip organised by my cute girlfriend..when i learnt about the place i thaught "...far away from the centre..." BUT fortunately it wasn't... you can pick up the train(100m distance on foot)and in 5-10 minutes you are at the heart of Barcelona.the hotel is clean,the room was very large and comfortable,bathroom great(better from my house :-) ) the breakfast was unbelievableee,extra large buffet with everything but you must pay 15euros more per person. NEGATIVES dinner was average and very expensive for my budget,another disadvantage was the main street exactly next to the hotel was really very noisy...that was okay with us because all the day we were off sightseeing and then came back exsausted(maybe for a family with babies that would be a problem). P.s front desk was very good and helpful anyway if you find it for a reasonable price don't even think about it and go ahead!! that was a really honest review...see you!

Reviews.Title: “Great price, good location”
Reviews.Author: budget_traveller59
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights after booking on lastminute.com. As others have said, it's not near the centre of Barcelona but it's less than 5 minutes walk to the station and only 20 minutes to town. Our room was lovely and clean with lots of light coming in and great views of the hills of Barcelona. The bathroom was huge and had a bath that you could actually stretch out and relax in. The bed was two singles pushed in together so not exactly romantic when you're on your honeymoon...but other hotels in Europe were the same so not exacly unexpected. The food in the dining room was variable. We had lunch there from the set menu when we first arrived and it was excellent. On the last night we stayed there we had dinner and it was not as good. We both ordered chicken and it was pink inside, but we did not get any sort of apology or discount which was disappointing. The hotel appears to be a teaching hotel which is perhaps why it was so cheap, but if anything that made it better. Staff seemed to genuinely try hard to help us (except that one time in the restaurant) and were very nice considering our Spanish was almost non-existent. The supermarket across the road (it's in the basement of the apartment complex - took a little while to find!) is very good and had everything you might need for lunch or snack.

Reviews.Title: “Location a slight drawback - easily accessible and a good place!”
Reviews.Author: guanointoronto
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised with this hotel. After reading mixed reviews, I wasn't too sure what we were in for. The room was most importantly clean with a nice and modern bathroom. The staff at the front desk were all very friendly and helpful. The only drawbacks were somewhat trivial - there was a computer in the lobby that allows you 15 free minutes of internet use per day and had to be used in one sitting which was a little impractical. I would not recommend buying the WiFi card they offer for 8 Euro because it did not work at all for me and it was more of a hassel trying to get the $$ back. Just as many other reviews pointed out, it is a little ways out of the city centre (12 minutes on the metro to be exact) but the stop is a few steps from the hotel so it really isn't too much of a hassel.

Reviews.Title: “PLEASE STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL!!”
Reviews.Author: pikesvilledonald
Reviews.Content: We were there for one night on our way to a 7 day cruise. One of our companions had her purse stolen from the dining area! She lost everything. The hotel staff was not helpful, and as a matter of fact downright rude. They refused to call the police, refused to let the victim phone for help. My group was horrified! The woman at the front desk hung up on visitors asking for washcloths and treated this group badly. I would never stay again. The good thing i can say is the food in the dining room was very, very good.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: businesstraveler450
Reviews.Content: As everyone has noted on this site, the Alimara is not downtown; however, as has also been noted, the Metro is round the corner and is a quick ride to Placa Catalunya in the center of Barcelona. The ride in a taxi to the airport was quick and painless, and cost 24 euro including the tip. The staff were accommodating and fluent in English. We arrived early in the morning and our room was ready for us. We had breakfast in the hotel one day, and got a discount because we booked it the day before. They had offered this discount (11 euro instead of 18) and then seemed confused when we indicated it. It was sorted out quickly and pleasantly though. Other people have noted the thin pillows (one on each of the twin beds) which certainly were not sufficient, but a phone call brought two extra each without a problem. Not the fluffy pillows we are used to in US hotels for sure. The beds were hard and low, and as I mentioned were two twins, not a queen or king sized bed. The supermarket across the street was great, and I am grateful to other TripAdvisor posters for mentioning it.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, elegant, clean, convenient, great value.”
Reviews.Author: PeterCToronto
Reviews.Content: This hotel gets you away from the busy and noisy downtown areas - there was the Merce festival going on so we could escape to the Alimara. Very easy access on the Metro. We were upgraded to Junior Suite without asking - huge room. Very comfortable place to stay. Breakfast was buffet style and excellent. Staff courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel in a very good location”
Reviews.Author: Trigo72
Reviews.Content: My wife just came came back from a fantastic week in Barcelona and stayed at this hotel after getting a good deal with BA flights on lastminute.com. We arrived late at night and the taxi from the airport was about 30 Euros, about the same as other people have paid on here. The hotel is and looks very new and is impressive from the moment you walk in. On the night we arrived, there was actually a local wedding taking place and that gave the place even more credence. The staff were very friendly and check-in was a breeze. There's a central glass lift that goes up the outside of the building and gives a good view of the ample greenery below. We were lucky to be up on the seventh floor and got a great view over the hills on the outskirts of Barcelona. The hotel is just a couple of minutes walk from the Mundet metro station which is on the green line 3 and can take you in less than 20 minutes to places like Passeig de Gracia (the main shopping area), La Rumblas, the marina, the magic fountain or to get a connecting funicular (on the same metro ticket) up Montjuïc to the castle or Olympic Stadium. It also gives good connections to other areas, such as the beach. Although the hotel is no where near the city centre or beach, we never thought this was a problem as the hotel looks far better than most of the hotel in those areas, plus it's in a very safe area. The breakfasts and other meals are pricey but for breakfast there's a little shop in the metro station where you can get coffee and a croissant for under two Euros. Plus with places like La Rumblas so close by metro it's convenient to eat there instead. We decided to save a taxi fair back to the airport and got the metro down to Passeig de Gracia instead where we caught a train (you can use your T10 ticket) to the airport, which was very easy. Overall, an excellent hotel!

Reviews.Title: “this hotel is a gem”
Reviews.Author: andylow
Reviews.Content: Actually i got a good bargain for this hotel, around 40USD per night, room is spacious, beside metro station and 15 min to PDG and cataluna. There's even night buses opp the hotel to bring you to cataluna and you can transfer to a nightbus to airport for budget travellers. free 30 mins internet usuage. but nothing much around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great bathroom!!”
Reviews.Author: Exchangers
Reviews.Content: Large and spacious room with awesome bathroom. Nice view overlooking the city. Very close to the metro station. Only concern is location from downtown core. When the metro stops running it would be an expensive cab ride back to the hotel. Great value!

Reviews.Title: “Close to the metro, in a quiet area. Friendly staff and very clean.”
Reviews.Author: lora160687
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 5 days. It may appear far from the city centre in the map, but the metro station (Green Line-Mundet) is 2 minutes away and it takes about 15 minutes to go downtown. The rooms had a relatively big space, the beds were comfortable and it was very clean. The staff of the hotel spoke English very well and they were very helpful when it came to information. Near the hotel there was a super market, so that was also a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Quality and Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Hollybopp87
Reviews.Content: Alimara is an awesome hotel! You should not be put off by its out of city location. Its on the green line which goes direct to some of Barcelona's most popular tourist attractions (Parc Guell, Las Ramblas, Plaza Catalunya), has good connections with other metro lines and the Sants train station. The staff are very friendly and keen to help. The rooms are clean, spacious and the hotel has great facilities. I really enjoyed my stay at Alimara and would recommend it to anyone, the nightlife in that particular area isnt up to much and the local amenities are lacking, but as I have mentionned you are on a main metro line and the hotel has a restaurant and bar. Very satisfied customer :D

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for my needs”
Reviews.Author: Jeaniewilburn
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business for two nights, it is out of the centre but i needed to be close to the Vall D'Hebron Hospital (just 10-15mins walk) so it was perfect for me. The hotel is literally 2-3mins walk to the Metro stop (Mundet-Green Line), it takes about 15 mins to get to Liceu (on Las Ramblas-the main shopping street). so it's perfect if you don't want to stayin the bustling centre, I paid about £125 for two nights. The breakfast was typical european with cereal, meats & cheese, and fruit, it is quite expensive at 14 euro's per day, i only had it once and wasn't too impressed, however the service was good, if you are no rush i would get the metro into town and go somewhere cheaper. My room was two singles pushed together but it was quite a big room and it was clean. The restaurant in the hotel is quite expensive and the menu doesn't really have much variety, think it's a french restaurant however the food was nice, I would go somewhere in town instead as there is so much more variety and it's cheaper. There isn't much around the hotel itself but you don't need it when the metro is just round the corner. It's a shame it doesn't have a swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, clean & accessible”
Reviews.Author: little_L86
Reviews.Content: Value: Very good for whats classified as a 4* hotel. I think we managed to get one free night and we stayed for 4 nights. It is a solid 3* as opposed to a 4* but you don't go to Barcelona to stay in your hotel! Accessibility: Literally a one minute walk to the metro station Mundet. It is on the green line which is where the majority of attractions are, so very handy. However, toward the end I did get a bit sick of the travelling. It is about 7-8 stops away which is about 15 minutes. In terms of the metro prices though, if you get the carte of 10 tickets as I did, the amount of stops you take doesn't actually make a difference in price so if you don't mind 15 mins every day to and back, and in between, then it is worth living out of the centre. We got a taxi one night from the port and it cost 20 euros. Area: Quiet residential area. There is suposedly a supermarket somewhere but we couldn't find it! Felt safe though, never felt threatened in the one minute walk back to the hotel! Rooms: Definitely spacious by european standards, with double bed, dressing table, wardrobe in the wall then a wee walkway to the toilet with bath/shower, a pedestal(!), toilet and basin. Lots of room for our luggage, us, and mess in general! I'm not fond of getting rooms tidied (just a personal thing, feels weird having a stranger in the room!) but when we did (e.g. when needed fresh towels) were always done whilst we were out and nothing went missing!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - Great value, great location!”
Reviews.Author: junkymotown
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights in this hotel, and was really impressed with the location. About 15 minutes on the metro from central Barcelona, and about 2 minutes walk from Mundet Station. The hotel itself is modern and spacious - same for the room, spacious and clean. Friendly, helpful staff. Great price!

Reviews.Title: “Location is closer than you think time wise”
Reviews.Author: Domenicd2000
Reviews.Content: the location wasn't in the heart of Barcelona so I only gave it a 2 for location, but only because you were forced to subway it to get anywhere and the subway stops running at midnight during the week. But as far as actual time to get into the main parts of the city, it only took 15 mintues which is very good. I rated this hotel based on a 3 star as 4 star is stretching it. quick check in was quick 1 minute to Mundant subway station quiet hotel/neighbourhood nice size room and bathroom would definately stay here again and when you can get the promo price, it is a super bargan would have been nice if the internet was included in our room cost as it was an extra charge for us

Reviews.Title: “An amazing stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: red_devil22
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 4 nights and were more than pleased with it. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were really,really spacious and comfortable - the tripple room was more like a small apartment. The hotel is a 2 min. walk from the metro station and it takes about 15 min. to get to the city centre. A small minus was the fact that shampoo and soap were concidered as a coplimentary product, but if you ask for them - you get them. I recommend that you don't take the breakfast at the hotel - it costs 10euro per person and for about 3euro you can have breakfast in one of the charming cafes in the city centre. All in all, an amazing stay in barcelona and an equally amazing hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean spacious room, great location”
Reviews.Author: Dunu
Reviews.Content: We are really happy that we chose this hotel. Just out of the city. but close enough o get to all the attractions. The hotel is in the same block as the metro (2-3 mins walk). just come out of the metro, walk up the left hand side ramp and then turn right near the lights. The hotel is at the end of the block. Great family run cafe for coffee/beer and food (try the grilled bacon sandwich) opposite the traffic lights (come out of the metro as if you are heading towards the hotel, cross the road at the lights, walk down the steps and its on your left).

Reviews.Title: “good value hotel, but a 3-star rather than a 4-star in general”
Reviews.Author: CarolPML
Reviews.Content: Location wise, it's close to the metro, but it takes about 20 mins to or from the centre at least. Sometimes, we just didn't want to travel for this long because we were quite tired. If you want to get food quick, there's an underground supermarket just in the opposite side of the road in the residential estate, which is rather convenient. There is not anything else worth seeing around. They are mainly residential buildings and an open-spaced car park around the hotel. First impression of the hotel wasn't bad from the outside. Interior was not too bad for a cheap "four-star" hotel, but it was rather simple/cheap and basic for a normal "four-star". I'd say it is really a 3-star hotel. Our experience with the staff for the whole stay was good. The most disappointed thing about the hotel was the facility provided in the room. The mini-bar only had a mini-fridge and 2 glasses. There was no kettle at all. Even the 3-star hotels I stayed in before had kettles!! I asked for a kettle, but they didn't understand this, so I didn't bother asking for one at the end. My husband and I did not really like the hard and thin pillow they provided. We didn't get good sleep the first 2 nights because it was so hard and thin. I felt like I was just sleeping on a few stack-up towels! Seeing these 2 important aspects that were not good in providing a basic, enjoying stay, I feel the toiletries they provided were a bit excessive. A sponge for shinning shoes and one other thing that I couldn't even remember that I didn't even find them in other 4-star hotels. Another thing that we were not too bothered about, but it would be good to have was the telly. We had telly in the room, but it couldn't receive any channels. We bought an Internet access card for 45 mins usage for 8 Euro. The computer desk and chairs were rather simple. It was in a cornor in the lounge area on the ground floor and there was only 1 computer and a printer (for all the guests usage?) We tried to print something but the printer only rolled and didn't print. There was probably no ink...? At some point, I did feel this hotel was a practice hotel for Barcelona University hotel management graduates, where their campus was just located opposite to the hotel courtyard. Although the campus does have its own entrance on the opposite side of the block for students but because the courtyard are connecting the hotel lounge and the back of the campus, and the reception for the exhibition was in the hotel lounge, some visitors who were going to an exhibition in the campus did have to go through the lounge area in the hotel first. Generally, the hotel room space & interior were OK, not bad staff service, but some important in-room facility was not good. For the price we paid, it was fair - we stayed for 3 nights and our third night was free because of promotion. The price we paid were only for room though. They charged about 13 euro each for a buffet breakfast. I couldn't make any comments on their breakfast because we didn't want to pay that much for it. However, we would not come back and stay in this hotel if we visit Barcelona again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent & mermorable hotel”
Reviews.Author: greengirl999
Reviews.Content: We stay here for 4 nights at the end of October as I got a very good deal on lastminute.com. We were happy to sacifice not staying right in the city centre, to stay in a 4* hotel. I think we must have gotten the best room in the hotel (901) as it was on the top floor, on a corner, with only 1 other room sharing a hallway. The bed & bedroom was huge & the bathroom was too. The staff were very friendly & spoke excellent English. Always very helpful too. We usually broke our days into 2, leaving the hotel in the late morning or early afternoon, coming back for a rest then going out again at night. The room was a nice place to spend time in. Go to the supermarket down the road for yummy breads, cheeses etc for breakfast/snacks. We also purchased pay TV movie, & we were able to access the Pay TV for 24hrs+ afterwards so that was a good deal! I would not consider staying anywhere else in Barcelona if I ever go back there. The Alimara was tops!

Reviews.Title: “exactly what we needed”
Reviews.Author: soapybubbles10
Reviews.Content: I took my partner to Barcelona for his birthday and booked flights and accomodation all through the same website and got a pretty good deal. We got the metro from the airport to the hotel which was really straight forward when you get hold of an undergound map. Just need to get the green line L3 to Mundet and the hotel is a about 100 yards away from here. There isn't any shops from what i could see surrounding the hotel but to be fair we didn't really look as it was so easy to jump straight on the metro and a few stops down you have restaurants, shops everything you need. The hotel staff were very friendly and spoke very good english. They were happy to help when we were looking for places to go and gave us a map to take away. The rooms were very clean and beds and towels changed daily. We didn't eat at the hotel as breakfast was 17 euros. Overall we were very happy staying at the hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “loved stay a bit out of the way”
Reviews.Author: alady13
Reviews.Content: Went to the Alimara hotel for 5 nights and had a lovely clean, big room, not exactly 4 * standard maybe 3* is more accurate. The main problem we faced was the total lack of food places near the hotel. After a long hot flight and travelling we went on search for food, to find out there is only 1 restaurant, which looks more like a run down shack. And one tiny shop which closes at like 7, which we just managed to get to. The metro stop is a 3 min walk which is perfect and 12 mins into las ramblas. The metro is fab, and v cheap. Good hotel for price we paid, no pool which was kinda sad.

Reviews.Title: “Some of their front desk staff might ruin your holiday mood”
Reviews.Author: MoCake
Reviews.Content: Even until the last date of our stay(We reserved 2 rooms month ago and they only gave us one room when checking in), none of the hotel staff talked to us directly / made an apology. They originally promised to refund the room they didn't give us for the first night (this is confirmed by several staff and they also offered breakfast and room upgrade as an apology for sqeezing 4 of us into one room). After we went back home, they said the breakfast and room upgrade they offered should be more than enough to compensate the room charge! We were trying not to let this incident ruin our mood, but they just kept irritating us (except one staff called Alberto who was friendly and responsive). When we talked to the front desk supervisor in our last date for the refund, we felt like a group of beggers causing troble and asking for money. Below please find the email I sent to their GM at 2am in the first night. Subject: To GENERAL MANAGER of ALIMARA Hotel - SERIOUS COMPLAIN FROM HOTEL GUEST Dear Sir/Madam, I'm your existing hotel guest staying in room 129 and I'm furious and disappointed by your poor service and disaster recovery. We reserved and confirmed 2 double-bed rooms from May 2 - 6th nearly a month ago, and I can't believe that this is what I have got: 1. Your first front desk staff only offered one room (number 419) and told us the hotel is full when we checked in at 10:30pm on May 2nd; 2. Your front desk supervisor made an excuse (electricity problem in one of our rooms which the first front desk staff never mentioned) and asked another couple of our group to take the taxi and stay in another place. Even after we kept saying that we were really tired and would really want to stay only in this hotel, the supervisor still wanted the another couple to move; 3. 4 of us had no choice but demanded an additional bed to stay together in one room. And surprisingly, your front desk asked us to stay in another room (room 129) so as to set up the bed. Is this a joke? because they have 2 rooms indeed and only assigned us in either one room!!!! 4. The extra bed was delivered only 40 mins after we got in by your SECURITY GUARD and no one made the bed sheets. So your staff were expecting us to set up the extra bed at 11:15pm on our own in this so-called 4 star hotel? I could't sleep until now because of the poor arrangement from your hotel and I really don't think we deserve this from our holiday. Yours sincerely,

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel a little far out”
Reviews.Author: Al52
Reviews.Content: 12 of us stayed here for a long weekend. We bought 4 day passes on the subway for 18 euro and hopped on and off the tube. The local station ( Mundet) is just round the corner from where you can be on the Ramblas in 15 minutes.A taxi from downtown is around 25 euro. The hotel itself is clean and friendly. The rooms spacious and light. Giveit a go!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MKE1978
Reviews.Content: Very spacious room with a great view (we were on the 9th/top floor). Clean and modern. There was some slight traffic noise, but not bad enough to interfere with sleeping. Check-in/check-out went very smoothly, employees spoke perfect English. There were two English TV channels - BBC and CNN. The hotel is very easy to access from the airport, but it takes approximately 45 minutes using public transport. Take the train from the airport to Sants station (the stop is labled "Barcelona" on the train's display), it will take about 20 minutes. There are 2 trains an hour leaving at :00 and :30. Then take the Metro green line #3 (direction Canyelles) to Mundet metro stop. Walk left out of the station, then turn right and walk to the end of the block. It takes just a couple minutes to reach Hotel Alimara from the metro station. As another reviewer mentioned, the Consum Supermarket is very close by. Turn left after leaving the hotel, cross the street and go down the stairs, go straight and then down more stairs. We purchased breakfast items from here and kept them in our fridge (after removing all the minibar items).

Reviews.Title: “You may encounter issues with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pv7721
Reviews.Content: When my SO and I saw the tempting offer of a one free night for this hotel, I automatically checked the reviews on TripAdvisor in order to make our minds up. And the majority of the positive reviews convinced us. We noticed thought that almost 3 years ago, there were some people not happy with their stay... So hear now what we have to say about our stay here. First of all, this so called 4 star hotel is badly located. It's in the north of the city, right to the circular highway surrounding the city. What does this means? Yes, it's quite noisy, so if you still want to go, be sure to ask for the room to be furthest possible from the highway (on the right side as you face the hotel). But don't bet your money that they will provide you with the room you asked for (we asked for a double room, got a twin one instead (it has happened, by the way, in all the hotels we had stayed before); however, the rest of the hotels gave us a double room when we had politely pointed out that this was our initial request; Alimara was the only hotel that refused that request, claiming that "no other double rooms were available). It is true however that the hotel is quite close (less then 5 mins waling) from the Mundet subway station on the 3rd line) which allows you to get quickly downtown. I recommend using the subway: even if tempted to walk, you'll soon find out that your plan didn't indicate that in order to get to the city center you'll have to cross the hill where the Guell park is located, and the streets are quite steep. Getting back to the hotel, the reception was quite glacial when I refused to provide them with the credit card details. They claimed that this way they were trying to insure we were going to pay the extras (like minibar and Pay TV). I insisted that we did not intend to consume anything from the minibar or to wath Pay per view. To this, they claimed that this was "the standard procedure across Spain" (fact denied by local Spanish relatives I asked). Finally, they gave up this request. As I've already said, breakfast is not included, but I won't recommend to pay 11 € / person / breakfast. Instead, wake up at 9, go out from the hotel, go left, cross the street, then take the stairs down, go underneath the building and you're in a space with residences around. There underneath you'll see the entrance to a Consum supermarket, where you'll find what you'll need for quite a fine and cheap breakfast (and lunch and dinner, also). The rooms are spacious though, but then you'll have the same thing I've seen in quite all the hotels I've been to: you need your unlocking card to be plugged in in order to have electrical power (however the air conditioned and the minibar seem to have their own circuit (we found the air conditioning running after room cleaning ladies passed and the things we left in the minibar were cold). About the Pay TV, there seemed be a bug in their system, and if you played a little with the remote you may be able to access directly the channels where the movies play (normally not directly accessible) without having to pass through the outrageous expensive Pay per view channels (10.70 € / movie). (They claim that in order to have Pay TV disabled in your room, all you have to do is to ask the receptionist; I did, but of course, he did nothing, even if he claimed the contrary). When checking out, we once again had a hard time explaining we didn't want to be in their "computerized guest database", that we didn't want to receive any offer from their part. One of the receptionist said "well, if you want to be removed, just call us", to which I said "what's the point into calling you later, I'm telling you to remove my information NOW!" The lady didn't seem to get it, so he asked another male coworker (who by the way had trouble to explain to a German couple that were checkouting too, and were about to discover that their advertised price was without VAT) and he assured me that any information about me was going to be removed (and sure, he was going to do that, just like his other colleague disabled the Pay TV). All in all, we had quite an unpleasant experience, and we don't recommend this hotel, who definitely doesn't deserve its 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great value!”
Reviews.Author: KamaLinn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in June for 2 nights. This was by far the best hotel and best value we had on our 3 week trip through Europe! I was surprised because it was only 70 euros a night, so I was expecting something horrible, but it was great! It was very nice looking from the walk-up. We arrived after midnight and the reception area was still open and helpful. The staff spoke multiple languages. The bedroom had 2 twins pushed together with seperate covers. The TV had CNN in English. The internet cost 7.80 euros for 45 minutes, so we did not use it. The bathroom was big. It had a shower with a tub (the first one of these we saw in Europe)! The room was very clean and very nice. There was a minibar and room service. The breakfast buffet was 11 euros, so we did not try it either. Very nice room, great hotel, great deal. The metro was very close to the hotel. It was very nice and clean. It looked like most of the trams were new. The stations were listed on the tram and would light up as you got to the station, so it was very easy to use. It would indicate with a solid light where it had been and a blinking light indicated that was the next stop. The stations were all pretty clean too. We liked using the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Roomy peaceful hotel near Metro station”
Reviews.Author: wickez
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from Barcelona in June 2007. Had tried to source for a good and cheap(er) hotel in the city but nothing decent was within budget. That said, we were a bit apprehensive with the booking, as it was quite far from the city centre. However, the short 2-minute leisure walk from Mundet metro station, which is on the green L3 line, made up for it. We actually asked for a double bedroom non-smoking, but got a twin room instead. We called to change and after a while, they gave us a smoking floor. There wasn't that lingering smoke smell, so we decided to take it. The rooms were very spacious, and some even had access to the balcony (for smokers). We stayed on the 5th floor, which was a little noisy (but bearable) from the Highway traffic. Pillows were very longish and flat (weird), so had to ask for 2 more pillows. But the bed was comfortable. Bathroom was huge and I do feel that they could have made better use with the space to afford a bigger toilet area. It was difficult closing the door with the bidet blocking access. Didn't have breakfast with the hotel, or try their restaurant, so I cannot comment. Overall, the hotel is conveniently located close to the metro, and on a L3 line which is directly accessible to city centre. It's about 15 minutes to Catalunya & Passeig de Gracia. The area surrounding the hotel is a quiet residential area, with a school and university (toursim) building. No other hotels around though. It's not the type of hotel to laze around in, the beach would be better for that. Price should be about EUR 120, without breakfast. Only problem is you have to watch what time the metro trains end, or you'll have to catch a cab back, which is not entirely cheap. I would definitely return to use the hotel, if they don't jack up their prices, unless I want to explore a different part of Barcelona. If you are the sort that would party way past midnight, I would suggest somewhere more central, so you get back easily.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SmitEnglish
Reviews.Content: Had a good time at this hotel which is very easy to commute to the central Barcelona via the Metro (Mundet Station on the Green Line 3). My room was on the 9th floor (the top floor) which was good as there is a busy (noisy) motorway next to the hotel. The bed and bathroom were both good (very important) and there was an electric safe in the room. My only problem was that the water in our bathroom sink would drain fast enough but I did not report this to housekeeping as it wasn't a major worry and I was hardly in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for Business and Leisure”
Reviews.Author: dana_christian
Reviews.Content: The Alimara was a perfect hotel. The room was nice and clean, and the staff always very polite and very helpfull ( restaurants ideas, transport). The hotel is close to a subway station, and without changing the line we arrived in like 10 min to the very center of Barcelona We will stay again in the Alimara
